body_content.explanation: to say or do something that shows a complete change of opinion or behaviour:
examples: After resisting the change, the firm made an about-face and embraced the new technology.
Instead, he chose to make an about face and pursue a different career.

body_content.explanation: to suddenly turn and face in the opposite direction:
examples: He saluted and made an about face.
She made an abrupt about-face as soon as she saw him walk in.
The flight control tower gave the plane the go-ahead to make an about-face and return to the airport.
